summary:
  content: Do you work with digital images in a humanities discipline? Are you
    interested in exploring the spatial properties of your dataset but don't
    know how? Or maybe you are just curious on the topic. This workshop aims to
    introduce participants to the technologies and technical abilities required
    for the spatial exploration of image datasets and is of interest to a
    variety of digital humanities students, scholars and professionals.

This workshop introduces participants to the background, and certain technologies and methods used for the spatial analysis of image datasets. The introduction provides a broad overview of the value of exploring the spatial properties of images while the rest of the workshop focuses on the methods of geotagging and spatial analysis through concrete examples and hands-on exercises.
